title: What would you do or not do in a self-driving car? - Quora

response.answer_text: Today, or in the future? I have a Tesla Model 3 with the Full Self-Driving Capability option, including the FSD computer. What I would not do today is take my eyes off the road for more than about 10 seconds, less on rural roads. I think that will give the reader a long list of other things I wouldn’t do by implication. If I don’t have to take my eyes off the road for more than 10 seconds, I am capable of interacting with the vehicle controls and it’s legal, then I would likely do it. I was driving on an interstate highway a couple of days ago when the car in in front of me suddenly braked and swerved. As they swerved, I saw the reason, a large part of a tire in the middle of the lane. I responded immediately, and I don’t think the car would have missed the tire on its own. It couldn’t have seen it coming. Unexpected things happen, and the human driver has to be prepared to take over. As for the future, I’ll just have to wait and see. I believe in principle that a self-driving car will be safer than a human-driven car, and I’ll be able to take a nap while the car drives. Until then I firmly believe that the combination of me and my self-driving car is safer than either alone.

I would not get in one . The claims that they are here now is flawed. I don't know how people like Tesla have convinced drivers they are. They are using customers as crash test dummies, and they are charging extortionate prices for something that does not work and may never do . And I have been driving for 40 years and only 1 accident many years ago. I don't need a car to tell me how to drive!!!!
Never take my hands of the steering wheel and constantly being alert to all the traffic around me. They are going to experience many wrecks over the years until the systems are proved 100 % reliable.

I’d take a cab first, at least there would be someone to talk to? RIding a subway would be more interesting. I can image what happens when one gets a flat tire or gets stuck in snow? A video on youtube shows how poorly a Tesla does going up a lane. Can’t make it over grass and some rocks that are embedded in the dirt. Or watch “Tesla VS Nissan Leaf”, please?
Listen to the radio? Watching TV might be possible but reading while sitting in a car makes me sick, so watching TV might also cause problems, I never tried. Eat? Sleep? I really don’t know.
I’d probably be in meetings or do work in a self driving car provided transportation time was included in work time (which I believe it would be after an initial acceptance period).
I wouldn’t sit in the back seat.
